entry.title: Wildfire burns in southern France forcing tourists and residents to flee

media:group.media:description:
One person has died as France's biggest wildfire this summer sweeps through a southern region, forcing tourists and residents to flee.
Officials called the scenes "hellish" after the blaze broke out in Ribaute in the region of Aude, close to the border with Spain.
The victim died in their home in the village of Saint-Laurent-de-la-Cabrerisse, about 20 miles north of the city of Perpignan, officials said.
Thirteen people have been injured, including 11 firefighters, since the wildfire started on Tuesday, authorities added.

entry.title: Tories claim credit for changes to crackdown on illegal working

media:group.media:description:
Shadow home secretary Chris Philp has claimed credit for measures announced by food courier companies to crackdown on illegal working.
Last month, the government signed a deal with the bosses of Deliveroo, Uber Eats and Just Eat to share the locations of hotels housing asylum seekers, in a bid to tackle illegal working.
The three companies have also now pledged to increase the use of facial recognition verification technology, as well.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/politics-latest-starmer-labour-badenoch-reshuffle-farage-12593360
#migrant #immigration #politics

entry.title: Trump could meet Putin as early as next week to discuss Ukraine ceasefire - White House official

media:group.media:description:
Donald Trump could meet Vladimir Putin in person as early as next week to discuss a ceasefire in Ukraine, a White House official has said.
They said the meeting would be conditional on the Russian president meeting his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Sky News's US partner network NBC News reported.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/trump-could-meet-putin-as-early-as-next-week-to-discuss-ukraine-ceasefire-white-house-official-13407912
#trump #putin #usa #russia

entry.title: Zoo staff face death threats for feeding baboon remains to lions

media:group.media:description:
Staff at a zoo in Germany which culled 12 baboons and fed some of their carcasses to the lions say they have received death threats.
Tiergarten Nuremberg euthanised the healthy Guinea baboons at the end of July due to overcrowding in their enclosure.
Some remains were used for research while the rest were fed to the zoo's carnivores.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/zoo-staff-face-death-threats-for-feeding-baboon-remains-to-lions-13407865
#zoo #animals #germany

entry.title: Woman told she may have to lose leg to stay alive after liquid Brazilian butt lift

media:group.media:description:
Warning: This story contains pictures some may find distressing
A woman whose daughter nearly died after a liquid BBL (Brazilian butt lift) procedure says she is "disappointed and upset" that plans to regulate the aesthetics industry could take years to become law.
Janet Taylor's daughter, Louise, was told by doctors that they may have to amputate her leg to save her life.
She was rushed to hospital for emergency surgery following the 2023 procedure, carried out by a non-medical practitioner.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/woman-told-she-may-have-to-lose-leg-to-stay-alive-after-liquid-brazilian-butt-lift-13407906
#cosmetics #health #uknews

entry.title: Lawyers sceptical of proposed reforms to tackle court backlog - data reveals

media:group.media:description:
Exclusive data from Sky News and the Law Society reveals strong scepticism among lawyers about proposals to tackle rising court delays.
With backlogs reaching record levels, Sir Brian Leveson has put forward reforms to fix a crumbling system, but many in the legal sector remain unconvinced.
Ashna Hurynag reports.
#courtreform #uknews #skynews

entry.title: Donald Trump says there's a 'very good prospect' he will meet with Vladimir Putin soon

media:group.media:description:
Donald Trump has been asked about the chances of a meeting with Russia at a White House event.
He says there is a "very good prospect" of that, but when asked about the chances of a deal he adds he's been disappointed before.
"But, there's a good chance that there will be a meeting very soon," he says.

entry.title: New AI technology to tackle grooming gangs

media:group.media:description:
Safeguarding minister Jess Phillips announced ¬£426,000 of funding to roll out artificial intelligence tools across all 43 police forces in England and Wales to speed up investigations into modern slavery, child sex abuse and county lines gangs.
Phillips denied Elon Musk influenced the decision to have a national inquiry on the subject.
The minister said: "I don't follow Elon Musk's advice on anything although maybe I too would like to go to Mars.
"Before anyone even knew Elon Musk's name, I was working with the victims of these crimes."
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/jess-phillips-condemns-idiot-councils-that-dont-believe-they-have-grooming-gang-problem-13407809
#skynews #uknews #groominggangs #labourparty

entry.title: War in Gaza: At least 20 dead after aid truck overturns, says Gaza health authority

media:group.media:description:
Warning: This video contains distressing content.
At least 20 people have been killed after an aid truck overturned in Gaza after being overwhelmed by crowds seeking food, according to Gazan health authorities.
Separately the Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid group says its headquarters in the strip have been struck again by the Israeli military.
It all comes as Benjamin Netanyahu prepares to push his security cabinet to agree to an 'all-out occupation' of Gaza.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/gaza-latest-hostages-famine-aid-hamas-idf-war-palestine-state-live-13398805
#gaza #middleeast #israel #war #skynews

entry.title: Prince Harry's charity row explained: What did the investigation find?

media:group.media:description:
A charity set up by Prince Harry in memory of Princess Diana has been at the centre of a high-profile row, leading to an independent investigation.
The Duke of Sussex stepped down from Sentebale in March alongside fellow co-founder Prince Seeiso of Lesotho, nearly 20 years after they started it to help young people with HIV in Lesotho and Botswana.
In the end there has been no outright winner from the regulator's verdict.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/no-outright-winner-from-charity-commissions-verdict-on-row-between-prince-harry-and-sentebale-chair-13407653
#skynews #princeharry #sentebale #charity

entry.title: Families fight to block parole for murderers who refuse to reveal location of their victims

media:group.media:description:
Families representing the victims of two of Scotland's highest profile murder cases have urged the Scottish government to deny parole to killers who refuse to reveal where they hid their victim's bodies.
The plan has been dubbed "Suzanne's Law" and is named after murdered Edinburgh bookkeeper Suzanne Pilley, whose remains were never found.
It would see murderers kept in prison indefinitely unless they disclosed the whereabouts of those they killed.
Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/families-fight-to-block-parole-for-murderers-who-refuse-to-reveal-location-of-their-victims-13407837
#scotland #parole #crime #justice #uknews #skynews

entry.title: What options does chancellor have to stop 'substantial tax rises'?

media:group.media:description:
Rachel Reeves will need to find more than ¬£40bn of tax rises or spending cuts in the autumn budget to meet her fiscal rules, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research (NIESR) has warned.
Sky's Gurpreet Narwan explains in more detail what options the chancellor has to prevent taxes from rising.
#skynews #taxes #reeves #chancellor #economy

entry.title: IDF blames Hamas for aid site shootings - while the UN disputes this

media:group.media:description:
"What happens is the hospital gets people who are mistreated, some of them are in crowded areas, some are getting shot by Hamas.l," said Nadav Shoshani, an international spokesman for the Israel Defence Forces.
The UN said in a report that nearly 1,400 people have been killed and more than 4,000 injured while seeking food.
